name: Red Roof Inn Buffalo Niagara Airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here the night before our flight and were extremely happy with our room. We have stayed in a lot of places and this motel is spotless and very cozy. We checked throughly for any sign of bed bugs and found nothing. Excellent choice at a great price!
reviews.title: Cleanest Motel I've ever seen!

reviews.text: Staff were great. Room clean and locale is set back from the main drag (Transit Road) with woods and deer.
reviews.title: Always a choice of mine when in Buffalo NY
We liked it at first but...
reviews.text: I want to say we liked this motel, it looked clean and cozy and the front desk staff was nice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But:
reviews.title: Looks just like their website photos!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room smelled of stale cigarette smoke despite being a non-smoking room. We were too tired and ignored it.
reviews.title: Great value, great night's stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this Red Roof as part of a trip to Newark NJ. We needed a hotel where we could leave our car for the five days we were gone and a one night stay before we left for our trip. The hotel ordered a private car to take us to the airport and also to pick us up from our return flight. They took our flight details and kept track of the flight so that the pick up service was on time. It was much easier than waiting for a timed shuttle which has been our experience in the past at other hotels. We did not have to call when our flight got in, our ride back to the hotel to pick up our car was waiting at the airport for us once we had picked up our luggage.
reviews.title: An Excellent Hotel for Park and Fly

reviews.text: Another good stay. Management and staff are top notch very friendly and helpful grounds are kept litter free and tidy
reviews.title: We'll always return

reviews.text: location is great for sh0pping and dining I always stay here because of all the aforementioned reasons.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay

reviews.text: I don't travel everyday, but I do travel frequently and this was my first stay at a Red Roof Inn and I must say that it was everything I could of asked for then some. The from check-in to check-out, everything was perfect. A quiet place, with clean rooms and very courteous staff. I would definitely stay again!!!!
reviews.title: very good value excellent friendly staff

reviews.text: The Red Roof Inn in Buffalo has a staff of pros, who make check in+out pleasent The rooms are very clean and well maintaned, the housekeeping staff is some of the best I have run into, the desk staff is the best
reviews.title: Wonderful visit

reviews.text: I recently stayed at the hotel as it was close to the Buffalo airport and I was leaving early the next morning. Check in was simple and quick. I was given a room at the back of the property which was great as I didn’t hear the highway noise at all.
reviews.title: Basic, clean hotel close to the airport

reviews.text: The room was very basic but very clean. Even though it was a non smoking room there was a definite smoke smell so somebody either smoked recently or it was a smoking room in the past. This was a bit annoying as I am allergic but it wasn’t overpowering.
reviews.title: Consistent

reviews.text: The toilet/shower area is very small but the sink and counter outside the bathroom was big and bright which was nice.
reviews.title: We'll always return

reviews.text: I took the shuttle in the morning. The driver was early and pleasant. I didn’t use the shuttle on the way back as the driver said it might take 20 – 30 minutes to get there so I took a cab. Flat rate of $15 was a bit much but that’s not the hotels fault.
reviews.title: Issues, but we'll go back

reviews.text: All in all excellent value for the rate paid and a better option than an early morning drive which includes a border crossing. Next time I have an early flight I will be staying again for sure.
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ok, never stayed at a Red Roof Inn and was a bit nervous.... was in town for one night and couldn't get a good deal on Priceline for this particular weekend for any Buffalo-area hotel......took my chance and went directly to this Red Roof Inn and from the time we walked through the front door we were greeting with a warm welcome. I think the fellows name was Justin, but I am not 100% sure. The room itself was a King, not a large room whatsoever. But the sheets were clean, the room was spotless. The bathroom sink is located outside of the actual bathroom (not my favorite setup for a sink). But it had a nice countertop and plenty of counter-top room. The lighting over the sink could have been a tad brighter for me. The bathroom tub/shower & toilet were in a small room with hardwood floors. The shower water pressure was a bit skimpy....but it worked, and again, all very very clean. The air-conditioning unit worked fantastic. There was a large window one could open up if you didn't want to run air-conditioning. There are 2 buildings both with 2 floors. Keep in mind if you need assistance, there are no elevators to 2nd floor. On check-out the gal that was working was extremely friendly and kind. There was free coffee/ tea and Sunday newspaper. I will return here again in the near future and have to say these employees care about this facility and the grounds. You are just a skip down the road from the NY State Thruway and many restaurants/stores all right down the road.
reviews.title: Wow....great value, clean, quiet, park-like setting!

reviews.text: I've stayed at this Red Roof Inn several times in the past, mainly when snowed in near the airport. I've never expected it to be a superior property, and believe in the main that you "get what you pay for." However, one January my room didn't have heat (at all -- for about 3 hours), and the most recent time my room was only superficially clean. Since I hadn't packed slippers, I was barefoot, and my feet got very dirty from the carpet, and perhaps the tile floor. Next time, I'll travel with cleansing wipes for fixtures, and slippers. Oh, and if you need a hairdryer, they have one you can borrow from the Front Desk. Though it's right off the interstate and a very busy state highway, the area is surprisingly quiet, bordered by woods and walking areas for dogs, and there are lots of restaurants nearby.
reviews.title: Stay here only in a "pinch!"

reviews.text: This Red Roof is clean, has helpful staff and is priced reasonably. I had a room with a refrigerator and microwave which made it convenient for a multi-day stay. The Wi-Fi was slow.
reviews.title: reasonable prices

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had attended an event in Buffalo, but being that it was a holiday weekend in both Canada and the USA, hotels closer to the city were either fully booked or their rates had been "cranked up" for the weekend. We chose the Red Roof Inn Buffalo Airport as an alternative and had a good stay there.
reviews.title: Basic very clean room; good value. No complaints.

reviews.text: The front desk staff were friendly, efficient and helpful. Our room, which was fairly basic, was very clean. There were no signs whatsoever of any bed bugs (and we always check closely for them at hotels). We had a comfortable king size bed and the room was equipped with a small refrigerator and electronic safe. It was a pleasant stay, good value for the money and we would return to stay there again.
reviews.title: Clean, but wouldn't stay there again

aka: Red Roof Inn Buffalo Niagara Airport Hotel Bowmansville
description: When you check in, check out the fantastic new amenities in our NextGen ® design rooms! The rooms at this 100% Smoke Free inn feature new, comfy Rest Suite beds by Serta, plush high-end bedding, new modern design flooring, comfortable new seating and a large, flat-screen TV. Located just 2.5 miles from the Buffalo-Niagara International Airport, Red Roof Inn Buffalo Niagara Airport offers a Park / Fly package, as well as free shuttle service to and from the airport. Red Roof Buffalo Niagara Airport is 100 percent Non-Smoking and renovated with all new rooms. All rooms at this Red Roof Inn offer free WiFi. Regular/Decaf Coffee and Tea available in the lobby. This location offers "On Command Video" with a selection of free TV channels, pay-to-view premium channels, and movies, as well as music and games. One well-behaved family pet per room is welcome.
